topics.body:
I just thought of something for those interested; the usa is less than a month and a half from having the supreme court rule on same sex marriage.

Best case scenario all 50 states in the usa have legal same sex marriage.
Worst case scenario only about 45 states or such.

There's a high chance that it will be legalized in all 50 by only one judge.  In other words the most likely outcome is complete legalization.



Also japan has recognized domestic partnerships; it's not marriage, but it's a start.  Japan for the longest time was anti-glbt, but they're warming up to it and I think it will go a lot more smoothly than in the usa.

The next metaphorical battleground for gay rights is probably going to be asia and such, because while a lot of the countries are anti-glbt it's because of wildly different reasons than in the west.  In the west anti-glbt sprung up because of religious reasons, in the east it's tradition.

Basically at this rate I wouldn't be surprised if say in 2040 the only regions left where gay marriage isn't legalized is in africa, the middle east, russia, north korea or other countries and such.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600
